BiblioData.Title: Characterization of individual polymer molecules based on monomer- interface interactions

Applicant.Name: HARVARD COLLEGE [US]
UNIV CALIFORNIA [US]
PRESIDENT AND FELLOWS OF HARVARD COLLEGE
THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA

BiblioData.Abstract: The invention provides 1 method for determining the duration of interaction of a polymer with a nanopore or ion permeable passage, the method comprising the steps of: (a) providing a structure comprising a nanopore connecting a first pool and a second pool, wherein a polymer to be analyzed is placed in the first pool; , (b) causing the polymer to traverse the ion permeable passage; and (c) measuring the duration of step (b).

Claims.P: 1. A method for determining the duration of interaction of a polymer with a nanopore, the method comprising the steps of:
(a) providing a structure comprising a nanopore connecting a first pool and a second pool, wherein a polymer to be analyzed is placed in the first pool;
(b) causing the polymer to traverse the ion permeable passage; and
(c) measuring the duration of step (b).
2. A method for determining the duration of interaction of a polymer with a ion permeable passage, the method comprising the steps of:
(a) providing a structure comprising an ion permeable passage connecting a first pool and a second pool, wherein a polymer to be analyzed is placed in the first pool;
(b) causing the polymer to traverse the ion permeable passage; and
(c) measuring the duration of step (b).
3. The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the structure further comprises a molecular motor.
4. The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein a protein comprises the nanopore or ion permeable passage.
5. The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the structure comprises a lipid bilayer.
6. The method of claim 3, wherein the molecular motor comprises a DNA polymerase, a RNA polymerase, an exonuclease, or a ribosome.
7. The method of claim 6, wherein the DNA polymerase is an E. coli DNA polymerase I or a T7 DNA polymerase.
8. The method of claim 6, wherein the RNA polymerase is T7 RNA polymerase.
9. The method of claim 6, wherein the exonuclease is exonuclease Lambda.
10. The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the nanopore or ion permeable passage has a diameter of about 1.0 to 4.0 nanometers.
11. The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the nanopore or ion permeable passage has a diameter of about 0.5 to 2 nanometers.
12. The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the polymer comprises a polynucleotide.
13. The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the structure further comprises a DNA binding protein.
14. The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the measuring detects an electrical property of the structure while the polymer traverses the nanopore or ion permeable passage.
15. The method of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein a protein does not comprise the nanopore or ion permeable passage.
